intro: Margaritolobium luteum, commonly known as the yellow globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its yellow, pea-like flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is known for its ability to fix nitrogen. Margaritolobium luteum is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
